sections.title: Inquisitor (Class Overview)
sections.description: Overview of the Inquisitor class including role, alignment, hit die, and starting wealth.

sections.title: Weapon and Armor Proficiency (Inquisitor)
sections.description: Inquisitors are proficient with simple weapons, hand crossbow, longbow, repeating crossbow, shortbow, their deity's favored weapon, light and medium armor, and shields (except tower shields).

sections.title: Spells (Inquisitor)
sections.description: Inquisitors cast divine spells spontaneously from the inquisitor spell list using Wisdom as their casting ability score.

sections.title: Domain (or Inquisition) (Inquisitor)
sections.description: Inquisitors select one domain from their deity or an inquisition, gaining domain powers but not bonus spells or spell slots.

sections.title: Judgment (Su) (Inquisitor)
sections.description: As a swift action, inquisitors can pronounce judgment to gain combat bonuses that last until combat ends, with various judgment types providing different benefits.

sections.title: Monster Lore (Ex) (Inquisitor)
sections.description: Inquisitors add their Wisdom modifier to Knowledge checks made to identify creature abilities and weaknesses, in addition to Intelligence.

sections.title: Orisons (Inquisitor)
sections.description: Inquisitors can cast 0-level spells (orisons) at will without expending them, though metamagic versions are expended normally.

sections.title: Stern Gaze (Ex) (Inquisitor)
sections.description: Inquisitors gain a morale bonus equal to half their level (minimum +1) on Intimidate and Sense Motive checks.

sections.title: Cunning Initiative (Ex) (Inquisitor)
sections.description: Inquisitors add their Wisdom modifier to initiative checks in addition to their Dexterity modifier.

sections.title: Detect Alignment (Sp) (Inquisitor)
sections.description: Inquisitors can use detect chaos, detect evil, detect good, or detect law at will, but only one at a time.

sections.title: Track (Ex) (Inquisitor)
sections.description: Inquisitors add half their level as a bonus to Survival checks made to follow or identify tracks.

sections.title: Solo Tactics (Ex) (Inquisitor)
sections.description: Inquisitors treat all allies as having the same teamwork feats for determining if the inquisitor gains bonuses from her teamwork feats.

sections.title: Teamwork Feat (Inquisitor)
sections.description: Inquisitors gain bonus teamwork feats every three levels and can change their most recent teamwork feat as a standard action a number of times per day equal to their Wisdom modifier.

sections.title: Bane (Su) (Inquisitor)
sections.description: Inquisitors can imbue a weapon with the bane special ability as a swift action, selecting a creature type that can be changed as a swift action.

sections.title: Discern Lies (Sp) (Inquisitor)
sections.description: Inquisitors can use discern lies as an immediate action for a number of rounds per day equal to their level.

sections.title: Second Judgment (Ex) (Inquisitor)
sections.description: Inquisitors can select two different judgments when using their judgment ability, using only one daily use, and can change one judgment as a swift action.

sections.title: Stalwart (Ex) (Inquisitor)
sections.description: When wearing light/medium armor or no armor, inquisitors completely avoid effects on successful Fortitude or Will saves that normally have reduced effects.

sections.title: Greater Bane (Su) (Inquisitor)
sections.description: The inquisitor's bane ability deals 4d6 bonus damage instead of the normal 2d6+2.

sections.title: Exploit Weakness (Ex) (Inquisitor)
sections.description: On critical hits, inquisitors ignore damage reduction, suppress regeneration for one round, and deal extra energy damage to vulnerable creatures.

sections.title: Third Judgment (Ex) (Inquisitor)
sections.description: Inquisitors can select three different judgments when using their judgment ability, using only one daily use, and can change one judgment as a swift action.

sections.title: Slayer (Ex) (Inquisitor)
sections.description: When using judgment, inquisitors select one judgment type to enhance, treating their level as 5 higher for that judgment's effects, and this enhanced judgment cannot be changed.

sections.title: True Judgment (Su) (Inquisitor)
sections.description: As a swift action during judgment, inquisitors can make an attack that forces the target to make a Fortitude save or die, usable once every 1d4 rounds.

sections.title: Team Leader (Ex) (Inquisitor)
sections.description: Inquisitors can spend 1 hour daily to grant three of their teamwork feats to a number of allies equal to their Wisdom modifier for 24 hours.
